content.question: Which of the following names a pair of elements that would likely form a substitutional alloy and explains why?

choices.label: <math alttext="N i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="N i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms would fit in the spaces between <math alttext="C u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms in the solid lattice.

<math alttext="N i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="N i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms would take the place of <math alttext="C u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms in the solid lattice.

<math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>W</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms would fit in the spaces between <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>W</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms in the solid lattice.

<math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>W</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms would take the place of <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>W</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms in the solid lattice.

content.answer: <math alttext="N i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="N i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ni</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms would take the place of <math alttext="C u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms in the solid lattice.

skill.text: 1.B: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate both particulate-level and macroscopic- level properties.
